channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Loose manhole, 4th July
item.description:
For 3 months this manhole has been loose. It is very noisy every time a car drives over. It is also extremely unsafe for cyclists.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12, Auckland Hill, West Norwood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street light out between 3 and 5 Kirkstall Avenue N17 6PH, 4th July
item.description:
This street light has been out for several days now. The sticker on the lamp post reads KA 2 B

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kirkstall Avenue, West Green, London

item.title: Large Black Bin from Smithies Court building dumped in front of residents parking gate in Trumans Rd, 4th July
item.description:
Large Black Bin from Smithies Court building dumped in front of residents parking gate in Trumans Rd for two days and constantly being moved to residents parking by people parking in Trumans rd
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Lydford Close, Hackney, London

item.title: Every week a white van is dumping loads of rubble at the side of soane house and outside shuts on Missenden this is getting out of hand now and costing the council alot of man hours to clear it up, 4th July
item.description:
Fly tipping outside soane house and missenden
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Roland Way, Walworth, London

item.title: Outside 116 Landcroft Road it’s the man that lives in 116a doing this, 4th July
item.description:
I have paid the council on two times to pick up rubbish this man keeps putting outside the house .. he lives at 116a Landcroft Road .. mr damal Jacob I have told him to contact the council and pay to get it collected And was told to shut my mouth and go in my house

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 118, Landcroft Road, East Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sewage leak?, 4th July
item.description:
There’s been a sewage leak between the flat and the park for the past three weeks and i don’t think anyone has reported it. i live in the estate across this doesn’t bother me but it’s next to the park and i don’t thinks it’s healthy.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): De Beauvoir Estate, Hackney, London

item.title: Front used as rubbish dumps. Rats and mice present, 4th July
item.description:
The front garden of the property is full of rubbish. It’s smells in the hot weather, it is unsightly and both rats and mice are in the garden.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Glyn Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken fence and litter, 4th July
item.description:
At the corner of Anerley Rd and Anerley Station Road the fence is broken and littered. It has being like this for months. This enced corner should be cleaned, fence fixed and somehow covered so it is not a continuose ground for litter. The tree should be planted.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Ridsdale Road, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped Matress, 4th July
item.description:
A matress has been dumped/left in front of the fence of 97B Tuskar Street. It has been there for around a month. The mattress keeps falling over and blocking the footpath. It is becoming a real hazard particularly to elderly and people with mobility issues. It would be greatly appreciated if this could please be removed asap.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 97, Tuskar Street, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Illegally drawn disabled bay, 4th July
item.description:
This fake disabled bay that was drawn\painted here by some residents has been here for quite some time now over a year and has been causing quite an issue in the area as to who can and can’t park I was wondering if anything could be done to remove this I would assume with a high pressured machine you could get rid if this in no time you would have to put some sort of sign beforehand to get residents to remove vehicles from said fake bay before there was any attempt at cleaning as there is normally a car there
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Haslam Street, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti in lift, 4th July
item.description:
Graffiti in lift hasn’t been cleaned and now there is new graffiti.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bethwin Road, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree around light is dangerous and over hanging the public highway, 4th July
item.description:
I complained under the following FMS number . FixMyStreet ref: 5006817 and was told it is down to me to deal with this issue. The tree is over hanging onto the footpath and is dying so it is the responsibility of Bexley Council to contact the resident to get it cut back to the back line. As it overhangs the footpath if I was to have an accident with it I would Per-sue a claim through the council so I am requesting that you deal with the property owner.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 171, Dorchester Avenue, Albany Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mess of bikes, 4th July
item.description:
Lime, Forest and Voi bikes and scooters blocking the pavement. Riders just throwing the bikes wherever they want even across the road on the pavement. This is dangerous. Please relocate the bike dock to a wider and safer place.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Church Row, Belsize Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The new road layout on green lane that gives priority to oncoming vehicles, 4th July
item.description:
Hi, The new road layout on green lane that is to give way to oncoming vehicles by the bridge is causing absolute chaos to traffic ever since its input. There was never a problem with the traffic flow but now there is a constant build up and it then also affects footscray road where there is now also excessive traffic. Doesn’t make any sense to put a traffic measure in like that that causes much more traffic. It may be narrow for when lorries are coming through so I understand why it was looked at but it is not working. It’s a shambles.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 209, Green Lane, New Eltham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: And again .....bin overflowing with litter, 4th July
item.description:
This ia now a reoccurring issue The two bins outside Palmers Green Library are not emptied and then litter start spilling all over the place

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Broomfield Lane, Palmers Green, London
